comment.author: 13358301@N08
comment._content: Hola, soy el administrador de un grupo llamado *Que bonito es Chihuahua ! ( Da 2 premios por imagen que subas ) y nos encantaría agregar esto al grupo.

comment.author: 13358301@N08
comment._content: Esta imagen a ganado un * Premio Tarahumara !!! Muchas felicidades y gracias por mostrar con tus imagenes ( Que bonito es Chihuahua !)

comment.author: 35715389@N02
comment._content: It says C. Juárez not  Cd. (city which it'd be the correct abreviation for city) of Juárez. It makes me wonder if it is Calle  (street) Juárez at Chihuahua, chihuahua.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: Entrada de los maderistas al triunfo de la Revolución en mayo de 1911. El portador de la bandera es el General Roque González Garza. Calle 16 de Septiembre y Juárez. El edificio de la torre es la Antigua Aduana (donde el día 21 de mayo se firmaron "Los Tratados de Paz de Ciudad Juárez. La foto es muy posible se haya tomado después de la firma. The Library of Congress tiene una foto en la que posan los firmantes de esos tratados): Mexican Peace Commissioners... by Scott Photo Co. hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cph.3c18311 Dr. Roberto Duarte

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: You can see a photo of Gen. Roque González Garza in Wikipedia, wearing the same clothes, posing with his brother Federico González Garza. That picture surely was taken at La Casa de Adobe during a reunion of main Revolutionists on May 10th 1911, after Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua, was taken. es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roque_Gonz%C3%A1lez_Garza Dr. Roberto Duarte

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Dr. Roberto Duarte--Thank you for the additional information about General Garza and this photograph.  We will add some of it to the record when we update.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
The name is Roque González (paternal lastname), Garza (maternal lastname). In México we bear both lastnames. General González Garza was provisional President on 1915.
Dr. Roberto Duarte

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: I found a very similar photo printed on The San Francisco Call, May 16, 1911 (Chronicling America, Historic Newspapers, The Library of Congress). That photo was shot from Roque González´s left hand, maybe at the same site. Above the picture it can be read: "Tryumphal entry of Madero, his wife and ward of honor, into Juarez after the surrender. Major Roque González is shown in front carrying the flag". chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85066387/1911-05-16/ed-... Dr. Roberto Duarte

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content:
Dr. Roberto Duarte:

Thank you for finding a similar version of this photo. We will add some additional information to the description.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: In www.flickr.com/photos/jesusduarte/5867796851/in/photostream you'll find a today's matching picture
